instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
Hello,

I've got this Macbook for data recovery, customer dropped a cup of coffee.

Motherboard is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A. Where should I start looking ?

[ATTACH type="full"]60302[/ATTACH]

Thanks
Sam

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
All USB-C ports have the same behavior?
Which areas have been affected by liquid?
Is the machine detected in DFU mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
Thank you for your answer. Yes, all port takes 0.04 amp, coffee on top of keyboard, around touchbar. No it's not detected in DFU, I've followed your URL and I successfully put MBP in DFU in the past.

[ATTACH type="full" alt="1638793855005.png"]60303[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
I forgot, you've mentioned short at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
What is the exact ohm resistance to ground?
Compare the value with the readings on all big coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
Thank you for your quick reply. 

I am getting 0v and 0 ohm on all big coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message: as all ports have same behavior, could it be SMC  chip ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
You cannot get 0 ohm on all big coils.
Did you check without charger, nor battery connected???

I was asking about "exact resistance"...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message: yes, only the board, nothing connected.  Is it not the way you want ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
Is impossible to get 0 ohm to ground on all big coils!

Please, post resistance to ground (ohm scale) on all big coils...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
ok, I hear the beep but value is 3.2 ohm

[ATTACH type="full"]60305[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
3.2 ohms to ground on CPU core coils look good.
But there are many other coils to check.

You still didn't post exact value from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; we need something to compare with...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
Looks like you have short between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and L7330.
This points to bad <CHIP>U7370</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message: thank you, so this is CPU power supply, is it worth trying to repalce it ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
8.6 ohm is not really short, CPU can still be good.
Of course, there is a big chance to be dead, but nothing to lose; just change <CHIP>U7370</CHIP> and try.

If possible, after <CHIP>U7370</CHIP> is removed, compare diode mode to ground with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message: After removing <CHIP>U7370</CHIP>, I saw short was on CPU. Dead MBP. Thank you for your help anyway.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Coffee dropped - PPBUS line short
threads.message:
Did you check the value on similar good board?
8 ohm may not be short in fact...
